prerequisite: Cohort 2011 and before: Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in NM, with a minimum CAP of 3.50 or be on the Honours track. Cohort 2012 onwards: Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in NM, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
moduleDescription: This special topics honours seminar will explore the major holistic, traditional, and complementary medicines that originated in Asia and are widely used in Singapore. Holistic health practices are global industries and in the biological and social sciences. In this course, students will study holistic health from a social construction of health perspective in order to examine how people understand, legitimate, and promote these “alternative” or “traditional” medicines. Despite the regional affiliation of health practices such as Chinese medicine, Ayurveda, and yoga with particular Asian countries, these health practices are more accurately understood as transnational productions.
